textBeforeTable: Resolute Forest Products Inc's Total Liabilities for the fiscal year that ended in Dec. 2014 is calculated as Total liabilities are the liabilities that the company has to pay others. It is a part of the balance sheet of a company that shareholders do not own, and would be obligated to pay back if the company liquidated. Definition Resolute Forest Products Inc's annual total liabilities declined from Dec. 2012 ($3,231.00 Mil) to Dec. 2013 ($2,558.00 Mil) but then increased from Dec. 2013 ($2,558.00 Mil) to Dec. 2014 ($2,815.00 Mil). Resolute Forest Products Inc's quarterly total liabilities increased from Sep. 2014 ($2,356.00 Mil) to Dec. 2014 ($2,815.00 Mil) but then declined from Dec. 2014 ($2,815.00 Mil) to Mar. 2015 ($2,658.00 Mil). textAfterTable: Total Liabilities = Total Assets (A: Dec. 2014 ) - Total Shareholders Equity (A: Dec. 2014 ) = 4921 - 2106 = 2,815 Resolute Forest Products Inc's Total Liabilities for the quarter that ended in Mar. 2015 is calculated as Total Liabilities = Total Current Liabilities + (Total Long Term Liabilities) = Total Current Liabilities + (Long-Term Debt + Other Long-Term Liab. = 488 + (596 + 68 + NonCurrentDeferredLiabilities + PensionAndRetirementBenefit + Minority Interest) + 3 + 1491 + 12) = 2,658 Total Liabilities = Total Assets (Q: Mar. 2015 ) - Total Shareholders Equity (Q: Mar. 2015 ) = 4746 - 2088 = 2,658 * All numbers are in millions except for per share data and ratio.
